title: SHO energy - block KE at one-sixth of period

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to one end of a horizontal spring, and the other end of the spring is fixed in place. The block is free to move in the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction along the surface with negligible friction. The block is held in place with the spring stretched some distance from its relaxed length, at which point the block-spring system has a potential energy of <math alttext="60 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>60 J</mtext></math>. The block is then released and starts oscillating. If the oscillation period is <math alttext="1.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>20</mn></math> seconds, how much kinetic energy does the block have <math alttext="0.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>20</mn></math> seconds after being released?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
